descriptionSet.display: Artist's book listing all open and declared armed hostile conflicts that have taken place between the year 1 and the year 2006.;Issued in clear vinyl pocket.;Accordion folded, printed on cream colored paper with a gilt fleur-des-lys-pattern. descriptionSet.display: An alphabet book of sexist language about women.;Book consists of 15 printed cards which slide into transparent paper sleeves (bound in accordion fold format) silkscreened with illustrations.;Special scalloped magnifying glass attached to front cover.;Edition limited to 120 copies, signed and numbered by the artist.;"This book was hand-set in Weiss Roman, Weiss Italic, and wooden type. The cards were printed on Stonehenge and the images were silkscreened on Kozo paper"--Colophon.;In slipcase, as issued.

descriptionSet.display: "In 25 'chapters', Carrión described all manner of human relationships simply by using names, which he arranged in ever-varying typographical relationships. The names approach one another, sometimes blend together and then separate again. Arguments is a sublime interpretation of the statement that he published that same year: "All existing things are structures. Everything that happens is a metaphor. Every metaphor is a meeting point of two structures."--Metropolis M. magazine, 2010, number 5.;Artist's book.

description.text: "In 25 'chapters', Carrión described all manner of human relationships simply by using names, which he arranged in ever-varying typographical relationships. Every metaphor is a meeting point of two structures."--Metropolis M. magazine, 2010, number 5.;Artist's book.

location.name: Calisphere. UC Irvine Libraries. Artists' books collection.

descriptionSet.display: A unique altered book. Artist has retained the original title although the word "encuadernacion" has been partially effaced from the title page. Original imprint: Sociedad de Bibliófilos Argentinos, MCMXCII. Pagination is that of the original publication. Most of the original text (on bibliomania, book collecting, and book binding) is still readable.;Artist's interventions include dying, drawing in ink, burning, sewing, painting, and hole punching. The top portion of each leaf is dyed purple; central sections contain a series of drawn, sewn, and burnt vertical lines. The bottom portion of each leaf is painted dark blue over a series of hatched horizontal lines drawn in ink, below which runs a single horizontal line of punched holes. Bound in original printed wrapper, the top 5 cm of which is intricately sewn with gold thread; the bottom 5 cm is painted blue and has been hole punched profusely; a single line of punched holes run up the the spine.

description.text: A unique altered book. Artist has retained the original title although the word "encuadernacion" has been partially effaced from the title page. Original imprint: Sociedad de Bibliófilos Argentinos, MCMXCII. Pagination is that of the original publication. Most of the original text (on bibliomania, book collecting, and book binding) is still readable.;Artist's interventions include dying, drawing in ink, burning, sewing, painting, and hole punching. The top portion of each leaf is dyed purple; central sections contain a series of drawn, sewn, and burnt vertical lines. The bottom portion of each leaf is painted dark blue over a series of hatched horizontal lines drawn in ink, below which runs a single horizontal line of punched holes. Bound in original printed wrapper, the top 5 cm of which is intricately sewn with gold thread; the bottom 5 cm is painted blue and has been hole punched profusely; a single line of punched holes run up the the spine.

agentSet.display: written and designed by Linda K. Johnson.

descriptionSet.display: Title from box.;Artist's book.;"Blessing Bowl is a book of blessings offered and received as part of daily life. Inspired by Buddhist monks (bhikkhus) who live their lives dependent on the alms or blessings placed in the bowl. Though most of these blessings are not grandiose they fill my beggar's bowl with all that is needed."--Colophon.;"A flag book structure with a circular format wraps around and comes together in the shape of a bowl. The blessings flow towards the center. Text is set in 12 pt Gills Sans and printed on a Vandercook letterpress from photopolymer plates. The bowl and blessing are Strathmore and Neenah over paper. The box is covered in Thai Unryu"--Colophon.

description.text: Title from box.;Artist's book.;"Blessing Bowl is a book of blessings offered and received as part of daily life. The blessings flow towards the center. Text is set in 12 pt Gills Sans and printed on a Vandercook letterpress from photopolymer plates. The bowl and blessing are Strathmore and Neenah over paper. The box is covered in Thai Unryu"--Colophon.

C."--Page 6.

agentSet.display: Matott, Drew Luan (artist); Cameron, Drew (artist); Turner, Jon Michael,1985- (contributor)

descriptionSet.display: Title and publishers from colophon; date from signatures.;Edition of six signed and numbered copies.;"A collaborative project initiated by Drew Matott and Drew Cameron of the People's Republic of Paper along with members of Iraq Veterans Against the War. Utilizing uniforms that they wore in combat, the veterans cut, cooked and beat their uniforms into pulp and used a spray-pulp printing technique to render images and text onto the sheets. This series was made from the uniforms of Chanan Suarez-Diaz, Jon Michael Turner, Adrienne Kinne, Drew Cameron, Cloy Richards, Matt Howard, Eli Wright, Nate Lewis, Mike Blake, Phil Aliff"--Colophon.;Issued unbound in envelope of handmade paper with ribbon and button closure. The image printed on the envelope is different for each copy in the edition.;Six of the sheets contain a series of images of a man removing/tearing away his military uniform; the two remaining sheets contain a poem and colophon.;The photographs were taken by Hannah Carpenter Pitkin, cf. OCLC 183890991.

description.text: Title and publishers from colophon; date from signatures.;Edition of six signed and numbered copies.;"A collaborative project initiated by Drew Matott and Drew Cameron of the People's Republic of Paper along with members of Iraq Veterans Against the War. Utilizing uniforms that they wore in combat, the veterans cut, cooked and beat their uniforms into pulp and used a spray-pulp printing technique to render images and text onto the sheets. This series was made from the uniforms of Chanan Suarez-Diaz, Jon Michael Turner, Adrienne Kinne, Drew Cameron, Cloy Richards, Matt Howard, Eli Wright, Nate Lewis, Mike Blake, Phil Aliff"--Colophon.;Issued unbound in envelope of handmade paper with ribbon and button closure. The image printed on the envelope is different for each copy in the edition.;Six of the sheets contain a series of images of a man removing/tearing away his military uniform; the two remaining sheets contain a poem and colophon.;The photographs were taken by Hannah Carpenter Pitkin, cf. OCLC 183890991.

location.name: Calisphere. UC Irvine Libraries. Artists' books collection.

descriptionSet.display: Title from spine.;Artist's book consisting of 3 sets of prints housed in a linen-covered clamshell box divided into three compartments. The forty-two print elements can be pieced together to form fourteen prints, which measure 10" x 14" each. Printed on the verso of each print are excerpts "from a manuscript that the artist discovered while in residency at the American Antiquarian Society in the fall of 2000. The handwritten pages, which numbered over three hundred in length, comprised the transcript for a series of congressional hearings held in 1871. The purpose of the hearings was to gain information about the activities of the group known at that time as the Ku Klux, a widespread organization that was responsible for a virtual reign of terror throughout the south in the decades following the civil war. The transcripts bear witness not only to the horrific acts of the KK, but also to the way in which they divided a community along racial lines by targeting anyone who resisted their vision of racial separation and white supremacy"--Colophon.;"To produce the printed pieces, multiple layers of text and imagery were hand silkscreened onto sheets of Arches Cover, then hand-colored. The images used for the prints are period photographs and engravings collected by the artist"--Colophon.;Limited edition of 40 copies.

description.text: Title from spine.;Artist's book consisting of 3 sets of prints housed in a linen-covered clamshell box divided into three compartments. The forty-two print elements can be pieced together to form fourteen prints, which measure 10" x 14" each. Printed on the verso of each print are excerpts "from a manuscript that the artist discovered while in residency at the American Antiquarian Society in the fall of 2000. The handwritten pages, which numbered over three hundred in length, comprised the transcript for a series of congressional hearings held in 1871. The purpose of the hearings was to gain information about the activities of the group known at that time as the Ku Klux, a widespread organization that was responsible for a virtual reign of terror throughout the south in the decades following the civil war. The transcripts bear witness not only to the horrific acts of the KK, but also to the way in which they divided a community along racial lines by targeting anyone who resisted their vision of racial separation and white supremacy"--Colophon.;"To produce the printed pieces, multiple layers of text and imagery were hand silkscreened onto sheets of Arches Cover, then hand-colored. The images used for the prints are period photographs and engravings collected by the artist"--Colophon.;Limited edition of 40 copies.

agentSet.display: illustrated, designed, and conceived by C. David Thomas ; introduction and text by Charles Fenn.

descriptionSet.display: "This book is printed in a limited edition of one hundred copies with ten artist's proofs. Each book is numbered and signed by C. David Thomas and Charles Fenn. All pages are printed on Vietnamese Do (mulberry) paper handmade in Dong O Village in northern Vietnam. The images are printed from a Hewlett-Packard Deskjet 970Cse. The text is printed letterpress in Monotype Bembo by Wolfe Editions in Portland, Maine. Each book is presented in a lacquer box handmade by craftsmen in Thanh Tri Village near Hanoi ... The lacquer box is contained in a handmade silk slipcover, also made in Vietnam. The silk was handwoven in Van Phuc Village near Hanoi"--Colophon.;"Incorporates passages from a fictional "diary" [of H̀ô Chí Minh] ... based on historical documents ... Also included are passages from Prison diary, a collection of poems written by H̀ô Chí Minh while he was in prison"--page 13.

description.text: "This book is printed in a limited edition of one hundred copies with ten artist's proofs. Each book is numbered and signed by C. David Thomas and Charles Fenn. All pages are printed on Vietnamese Do (mulberry) paper handmade in Dong O Village in northern Vietnam. The images are printed from a Hewlett-Packard Deskjet 970Cse. The text is printed letterpress in Monotype Bembo by Wolfe Editions in Portland, Maine. Each book is presented in a lacquer box handmade by craftsmen in Thanh Tri Village near Hanoi ... The lacquer box is contained in a handmade silk slipcover, also made in Vietnam. The silk was handwoven in Van Phuc Village near Hanoi"--Colophon.;"Incorporates passages from a fictional "diary" [of H̀ô Chí Minh] ... based on historical documents ... Also included are passages from Prison diary, a collection of poems written by H̀ô Chí Minh while he was in prison"--page 13.

agentSet.display: California Arts Council (sponsor); Norman, Bonnie Thompson; Woman's Building (Los Angeles, Calif.) (publisher)

descriptionSet.display: Flag book structure with accordion structure binding. "The illustrations are hand carved linoleum blocks ... the binding was constructed by hand as well ... The project was funded in part by the California Arts Council ... Produced in a class taught by California Arts Council artist-in-residence, Bonnie Thompson Norman, at the Women's Building"--Colophon.;Letterpress printed collaborative artists' book produced as a class project in a course taught by California Arts Council artist-in-residence, Bonnie Thompson Norman. Students included are Kimmer Enoedy, Julia Akiko Seko, Dan Strehl, Bella Mokover and Martina Wilson. Illustrations are linocuts. The binding is a concertina with paper covered boards based on a concept by Hedi Kyle and commonly called her flag book.

description.text: Flag book structure with accordion structure binding. "The illustrations are hand carved linoleum blocks ... the binding was constructed by hand as well ... The project was funded in part by the California Arts Council ... Produced in a class taught by California Arts Council artist-in-residence, Bonnie Thompson Norman, at the Women's Building"--Colophon.;Letterpress printed collaborative artists' book produced as a class project in a course taught by California Arts Council artist-in-residence, Bonnie Thompson Norman. Students included are Kimmer Enoedy, Julia Akiko Seko, Dan Strehl, Bella Mokover and Martina Wilson. Illustrations are linocuts. The binding is a concertina with paper covered boards based on a concept by Hedi Kyle and commonly called her flag book.

location.name: Calisphere. UC Irvine Libraries. Artists' books collection.

descriptionSet.display: Collective cover title. Each volume has "Martyr, Mercury, & Rooster" printed on pages 1 of cover, with the title of the respective book printed in light gray and the others printed blind. Each volume also has individual title-page.;A collaborative project between Caren Heft and Jeffrey Morin. Various colored and textured Root Mill cotton, Larroque and Hahnemuhle papers. Ornamentation includes onlays of metal, string, tape, plastic, pins, mica, beads and paper. All books printed in 14 point Cochin Light. Pale blue-green textured cloth dropback box with small mica square inlaid on front.;Sibongile and the murderous rooster is illustrated with multi-color linocuts.;Edition of 50.

description.text: Collective cover title. Each volume has "Martyr, Mercury, & Rooster" printed on pages 1 of cover, with the title of the respective book printed in light gray and the others printed blind. Each volume also has individual title-page.;A collaborative project between Caren Heft and Jeffrey Morin. Various colored and textured Root Mill cotton, Larroque and Hahnemuhle papers. Ornamentation includes onlays of metal, string, tape, plastic, pins, mica, beads and paper. All books printed in 14 point Cochin Light. Pale blue-green textured cloth dropback box with small mica square inlaid on front.;Sibongile and the murderous rooster is illustrated with multi-color linocuts.;Edition of 50.

location.name: Calisphere. UC Irvine Libraries. Artists' books collection.

descriptionSet.display: Artist's book.;"Designed, printed, and bound by Maria Veronica San Martin. Images are etchings, dry points, aquatint, woodcuts, and screenprints printed on Rives BFK heavyweight cream paper. Typeface is Courier and Elemental Sans."--Colophon.;"'Memory and Landscape: Unveiling the Historic Truths of Chile' is a book of resistance that carries forward the protest and history of the disappearance of people in Chile during the dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet."--[Preface];Text includes a timeline of events 1973-1990, biographies of the disappeared and executed in Chile, and a list of disappeared detainees and executed in Chile. Images are accordion-folded with portraits of the disappeared and executed on one side, and depictions of historic events during the military dictatorship on the other.

description.text: Artist's book.;"Designed, printed, and bound by Maria Veronica San Martin. Images are etchings, dry points, aquatint, woodcuts, and screenprints printed on Rives BFK heavyweight cream paper. Typeface is Courier and Elemental Sans."--Colophon.;"'Memory and Landscape: Unveiling the Historic Truths of Chile' is a book of resistance that carries forward the protest and history of the disappearance of people in Chile during the dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet."--[Preface];Text includes a timeline of events 1973-1990, biographies of the disappeared and executed in Chile, and a list of disappeared detainees and executed in Chile. Images are accordion-folded with portraits of the disappeared and executed on one side, and depictions of historic events during the military dictatorship on the other.

descriptionSet.display: Unique book.;Consists chiefly of rubbings made with "wax crayon and graphite on pages of handmade Japanese kozo paper ... The covers are traditional handmade Nagabanshi kozo naturally dyed with persimmon and walnut juice. The rubbings are from the Einstein Memorial in Washington D.C., the Chandi and Labor History memorial plaques in Union Square, New York City; architectural plaques throughout NYC, the Confucius Memorial in Chinatown, NYC, and the Foley Square NYC history plaques in NYC ... This book was made over the course of four months from November 2006 through February 2007"--Artist's description.;Bound in "a hand sewn semi-exposed pamphlet stitch, designed and bound by Veronika Schäpers in Tokyo, Japan using Asaito thread"--Artist's description.

description.text: Unique book.;Consists chiefly of rubbings made with "wax crayon and graphite on pages of handmade Japanese kozo paper ... The covers are traditional handmade Nagabanshi kozo naturally dyed with persimmon and walnut juice. The rubbings are from the Einstein Memorial in Washington D.C., the Chandi and Labor History memorial plaques in Union Square, New York City; architectural plaques throughout NYC, the Confucius Memorial in Chinatown, NYC, and the Foley Square NYC history plaques in NYC ... This book was made over the course of four months from November 2006 through February 2007"--Artist's description.;Bound in "a hand sewn semi-exposed pamphlet stitch, designed and bound by Veronika Schäpers in Tokyo, Japan using Asaito thread"--Artist's description.

descriptionSet.display: Author, title, and artist information from colophon.;Fabric covered box containing a cast paper doll and five pink paper dresses, with lace and bead embellishments. descriptionSet.display: Book of art on assorted paper contained in a corrugated cardboard box. Compiled by nine Sublevarte Colectivo artists. The work was catalyzed by a Sublevarte residency and exhibition at the Interference Archive in Brooklyn, and by conversations with Booklyn's directing curator Marshall Weber.;Contributors [from Booklyn Artists Alliance website]: Irina Arellano-Weiss, Luis Ramón Campos Garcia, Andree Lilian Guigue Pérez, Joel Martinez Huerta, Veronica Median Juárez, Lourdes Alettia Molina Rivera, Ghandi Noyola Velázquez, Marco Antonio Rodriguez Gutiérrez, Mariana Sasso Rojas.;18 copies created.
